Job Description Would you like to be a Sr. Data Engineering Manager for one of the premier healthcare technologies companies in the world. The role would be fully remote, but we would highly prefer someone who is local to Southern California.They are the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing cutting-edge technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, they have focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class—while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the U.S., Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs approximately 6,000 people and value a remote first company culture.This person will be responsible for helping take majority of the people management duties off the Director's plate. It will be hands-off and focused on owning the strategy and roadmap of technical architecture. Someone who knows tech well and able to jump in and be involved in the architecture when needed will be the best fit. Someone who isn't technical every single day but not far removed from it. Must have experience managing people. Required Skills & Experience 5+ years (2+ in Management)Experience managing people (global and remote)Designing organization structure Managing vendor relationship managementData Engineering and DWH backgroundSnowflakeBig QueryData IngestingData TransformationData Analytics What You Will Be Doing TEAM: 7 total (3 FTE, 4 consultants) They want to build the core team over the span of this year. The core team will then seek outside help from consultants on big projects and releases. The Offer You will receive the following benefits:Medical InsuranceDental BenefitsVision BenefitsPaid Time Off (PTO) (4 weeks of vacation to start, five sick days, and two volunteer days)401(k) {including match- if applicable}Bonus (discretionary, depends on candidate & experience) Stock Continued trainings and support for professional growth Fun, high-energy culture with collaboration at every levelApplicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.Posted By: Connor Hart
